posted_tweets.content: 6 months to ML eng. Or you just start building. Pick one.
Edge inference is crap. Ship or wait.
GPT-5 generates polished UIs with clean code. Putain, what if we use it for SSI interfaces? Simplify identity management with auto-generated, secure UIs. Who's tried this?

Universal Commerce Protocol means one thing for devs: Agent Engine Optimization > SEO. Time to expose your data structure, not just your UI. Who's ready to build for machines, not just humans?

Genspark's $36M ARR in 45 days with no-code agents is wild. But what's crazier? They didn't need to reinvent the wheel. What if we applied this 'build on top' mentality to SSI? Less focus on bespoke auth, more on integrating with what already works.
Claude Opus 4.5 on Vercel's AI Gateway is a beast for coding tasks. But what if we used it to auto-generate SSI interfaces? Simplify identity management with zero UI overhead. Who's tried this?
